page.title: 02MAY DAY IN HALLOW VILLAGE
page.content: {May Day}is a very special day in Hallow village. Many people take part in the celebrations for{May Day}most important are the children from{Hallow {Primary School.}The reason for this is that as a church of England school, the children celebrate the church's {patronal festival}day too, that of St James and St Philip.They attend a sevice in the church after which they are provided with a tea in the village hall along with the Sunday School children,the{May Queen}and her attendents.After this they walk to the Village Green and there they make a guard of honour for the{May Queen}who has been chosen from the Sunday School. After the{May Queen}is crowned the children dance round the{Maypole making colourful patterns with the{May {pole}ribbons.The boys do{Morris {Dancing}in traditional costume.
